Sentencas: Solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs) convert renewable electricity to fuels with efficiency substantially higher than other electrolysis technologies.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects

Sentencas: However, questions remain regarding degradation mechanisms that limit SOEC long-term stability.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects

Sentencas: One of the key degradation mechanisms is oxygen electrode delamination; although prior studies have improved the understanding of this mechanism, it is still difficult to predict how degradation depends on SOEC materials and operating conditions, i.e., temperature, voltage, and current density.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects

Sentencas: Here we present a study aimed at developing a quantitative understanding of oxygen electrode delamination.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects

Sentencas: Experimentally, a life test study of symmetric and full cells with yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolytes and Gd-doped ceria (GDC) barrier layers was done with three different perovskite oxygen electrode materials.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects

Sentencas: Fracture was observed at the perovskite-GDC interface above a critical current density and below a critical operating temperature.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects

Sentencas: A theory is presented that combines a calculation of the effective oxygen pressure across the electrolyte with an estimation of the pressure required for fracture.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects

Sentencas: Fracture is correctly predicted for a critical oxygen partial pressure of similar to 7200 atm and an associated electrode overpotential of similar to 0.2 V, occurring at the electrode/GDC interface because of the relatively low perovskite fracture toughness.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects

Sentencas: Damage at the GDC/YSZ interface was also observed in some cases and explained by a peak in the oxygen pressure at this interface.
Titulo: Conditions for stable operation of solid oxide electrolysis cells: oxygen electrode effects
